questionListItems.title: What time do the students start and end their day?

answer.body: Depending on the programme, students can start their day as early as 6am and end at around 10:30pm.

questionListItems.title: Will there be water-heaters available for showers?

answer.body: There is no water heater for showers during the course.

questionListItems.title: Where will my child sleep during the camp? What happens if my child is sick or needs help at night?

answer.body: The students will be sleeping in tents and can reach the instructors who will be at close range to the students during the night. Should students become unwell, instructors will attend to them or take them to the medical centre to be examined by a nurse.

questionListItems.title: Are there any height-based or high element activities included in the course?

answer.body:
There will be height-based activities during the course. Before students embark on the high rope courses, Instructors will teach the students about the equipment, proper techniques of belay and practice the different roles in the belay team.

Only when the team is competent, they will proceed to the high rope courses and apply the newly acquired skills.

questionListItems.title: What kind of activities will my child be going through in OBS?

answer.body:
Your child will be engaged in a variety of outdoor activities that will help to discover and challenge his/her personal limits.

Some of these activities include problem-solving activities, adventure activities conducted over land and water body. It allows students to reconnect with nature, and develop their resilience and connectedness with nature while having a positive mindset in managing difficult situations.

questionListItems.title: When will parents be informed of the location of child's OBS course?

answer.body: You may wish to check with the school one week before the course.

questionListItems.title: As OBS will be safekeeping my child’s handphone during the course, how can I reach them?

answer.body:
If you need to reach your child for any emergency, you may contact the school’s teacher coordinator, who will contact the OBS Programme Manager.


Your child’s mobile phone will be safekept by OBS to ensure minimal distraction during the course, to disconnect from technology and to connect with their peers.

questionListItems.title: Which meals will be provided by OBS? Do I need to pack extra snacks for my child?

answer.body:
Breakfast, lunch and dinner, with light snacks will be provided for your child, hence they do not have to bring any extra snacks.


Do encourage your child to have a heavy breakfast before reporting to OBS on Day 1. They can expect a simple lunch on Day 5 before leaving OBS for school.

questionListItems.title: Where will the course and expeditions take place?

answer.body: Different activities will be conducted on mainland Singapore and/or Pulau Ubin. The OBS course is designed such that despite the different types of activities, students can achieve almost the same learning outcomes.

questionListItems.title: What if I did not receive an acknowledgement email from OBS after I submitted the form online?

answer.body: Please inform the school through your child’s teacher if you have submitted the e-registration form but did not receive an acknowledgement email. Your child’s teacher will check with the enrolment team and advise you on how to proceed.

questionListItems.title: I am a Singaporean/PR, but I do not have a SingPass. How do I register my child for the OBS course?

answer.body: You may register for a Singpass via https://www.singpass.gov.sg/home/ui/register/instructions.The link also provides responses for other queries related to Singpass.

questionListItems.title: What will the instructor do if my child has sleepwalking issues? Can they continue with the course or they need to be pick up by parents?

answer.body: Students with sleepwalking condition with the last date of occurrence within the last 12 months will not be allowed to stay overnight during the course. Schools will arrange with parent to fetch student from the OBS campus in the evening and to report back the next morning daily.

questionListItems.title: My child has past medical injuries and medical conditions, will he/she be able to join the course?

answer.body: Depending on the condition and recovery status, OBS will require a review of the medical injuries and conditions to assess the suitability of the condition for course participation. For this purpose, we will require Parents/Guardian to declare the child’s condition or medical follow-up accurately during the registration process.

questionListItems.title: What is the medical condition(s) which the student will not be enrolled into the course?

answer.body:
OBS reviews admission conditions periodically and as of October 2023, the following are non-admissible conditions:

  • Epilepsy / fits / seizures – Any episodes or on medication within the last 2 years;

  • Unavoidable allergens resulting in severe allergic reaction – e.g. traces of allergen, insect bites, unknown allergens that triggers life threatening reactions;

  • Thalassemia Major;

  • Conditions leading to exemption from PE, on medical leave or light duty that covers the period of the course;

  • Psychological/ behavioural conditions that may pose harm to oneself or others;

  • Any conditions that may impair movement and/or adversely affect safety to self or others during the course.

questionListItems.title: How do we update medical information (new condition) after previous declaration?

answer.body: You may wish to consult your family physician if uncertain. If your child is medically fit, indicate your child's medical condition(s) in the registration form and our medical team will assess your child's condition against other considerations for suitability to participate in the course.
